alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Nemaha; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 4:53PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Johnson, Nemaha and southeastern Otoe Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 453 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southwest of Brock, or 10 miles northwest of Auburn, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Auburn and Julian around 505 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Peru, Nemaha and Brownville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
